Based on the search results, I can provide you with a comprehensive overview of Tom Sawyer film adaptations across different media formats throughout history:

## Early Film Adaptations

The first film version of Tom Sawyer was made in 1907, which Mark Twain lived long enough to have seen. Tom Sawyer has been the most frequently filmed of Mark Twain's books, filmed three times before Huck Finn was filmed at all.

## Chronological List of Major Adaptations

### Early Sound Era
- **Tom Sawyer (1930)** - American pre-Code comedy-drama directed by John Cromwell and starring Jackie Coogan
- **Tom Sawyer (1936)** - A Soviet Union version directed by Lazar Frenkel and Gleb Zatvornitsky
- **The Adventures of Tom Sawyer (1938)** - Filmed in Technicolor by the Selznick Studio, the first film version of the novel to be made in color

### Television Era
- **The Adventures of Tom Sawyer (1960)** - BBC television series in 7 episodes starring Fred Smith as Tom and Janina Faye as Becky
- **Aventurile lui Tom Sawyer (1968)** - Romanian movie directed by Mircea Albulescu
- **Tom Sawyers und Huckleberry Finns Abenteuer (1968)** - A Romanian TV mini series directed by Mihai Iacob and Wolfgang Liebeneiner, starring Roland Demongeot as Tom and Marc Di Napoli as Huckleberry Finn
- **The New Adventures of Huckleberry Finn (1968)** - A half-hour live-action/animated series produced by Hanna-Barbera Productions

### Musical Film Era
- **Tom Sawyer (1973)** - American musical film adaptation directed by Don Taylor, featuring Johnny Whitaker in the title role, Jeff East as Huck Finn, Jodie Foster as Becky Thatcher, and Celeste Holm as Aunt Polly

### Animated Adaptations
- **The Adventures of Tom Sawyer (1980)** - Japanese anime television series produced by Nippon Animation, which premiered on January 6, 1980, and was broadcast on the World Masterpiece Theater. This series was dubbed into English and broadcast on HBO in 1988

### Modern Era
- **Tom and Huck (1995)** - American adventure comedy-drama film starring Jonathan Taylor Thomas and Brad Renfro, directed by Peter Hewitt and released December 22, 1995
- **Tom Sawyer (2000)** - American animated musical adventure film directed by Paul Sabella and Phil Mendez, released direct-to-video on April 4, 2000. This adaptation featured a cast of anthropomorphic animals instead of humans, with voices performed by country singers including Rhett Akins, Mark Wills, Lee Ann Womack, Waylon Jennings, and Hank Williams Jr., as well as Betty White
- **Rascals and Robbers: The Secret Adventures of Tom Sawyer and Huck Finn (1982)** - American made-for-television adventure film originally broadcast February 27, 1982 on CBS
- **Tom Sawyer (2011)** - German movie directed by Hermine Huntgeburth, starring Louis Hofmann as Tom and Leon Seidel as Huck
- **Tom Sawyer & Huckleberry Finn (2014)** - Movie directed by Jo Kastner, starring Joel Courtney as Tom and Jake T. Austin as Huck
- **Band of Robbers (2015)** - American crime comedy film written and directed by Aaron and Adam Nee, starring Adam Nee as Tom and Kyle Gallner as Huck

### Other Notable Appearances
- **Wishbone (1995)** - A PBS television series episode entitled "A Tail in Twain"
- **The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen (2003)** - Thomas Sawyer appears as a young adult U.S. Secret Service agent, portrayed by Shane West

The adaptations span various formats including live-action films, animated movies, television series, and even international productions, demonstrating the enduring appeal of Mark Twain's classic character across different cultures and generations.
